 I am shocked to find out that we are still practising fluoridation of our tap water. I read this message from a local water dispenser company Coral Pure Natural.

 

Are you aware that fluoride is related to many chronic health issues? Fluoridation has been banned in most countries. SG still practices fluoridation. Yet, more than 95% of the water purifier brands are unable to remove fluoride.

The fluoridation of drinking water is implemented by PUB in accordance with MOH’s policy as a key strategy to prevent tooth decay. We would like to assure you that PUB takes water quality very seriously. We conduct daily testing of water samples from source to our distribution network across the island. Thus, I attended the NEWater Visitor Centre yesterday to gain more insights regarding the water system in Singapore. I find it fascinating how Singapore uses such advanced technology and using 100% green energy to manage the water cycle here! As I pondered, here are some questions that arose in my mind: 
• For the 4 national water taps, are they all purified through the 3-Step Purification Process (Microfiltration/Ultrafiltration, Reverse Osmosis, and Ultraviolet Disinfection) or does only NEWater undergo that purification step? If the other national taps other than NEWater undergoes these processes, why can't NEWater be used as tap water for drinking (putting aside the fact that it is sometimes used if there is no rain for 4-5 weeks in Singapore and that the water supply is in a 'dangerous' level)?
• I would like to ask from an expert's point of view on what you think are the most important factors in determining whether water is potable. (For example: pH, nitrate concentration, hardness of water, bacterial concentration, etc.)

Dear [REDACTED],


 

Different treatment processes are used to treat the different source waters for 4 National Taps. More details on the potable water treatment processes can be found in these links (Water Treatment  , Desalinated Water  ). Each method of treatment is customised to take into consideration the nature of the source water as well as its intended usage. Only NEWater undergoes the 3-step purification process (i.e. microfiltration/ultrafiltration, reverse osmosis and UV disinfection) to produce ultrapure water.
